intro: Thlaspi alpestre subsp. occitanicum, commonly known as the Pyrenean cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, bright yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the spring and early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly different morphology compared to the main species, including variations in leaf shape and size.
